hypothesis: Rhode Island was the third state to ratify the Articles of Confederation.

explanation_1: Rhode Island was the first state to ratify the Articles of Confederation.

explanation_1: Abraham Lincoln was assassinated in 1865.

hypothesis: Gone with the Wind is a book.
premise: + Gone with the Wind (novel) + Gone with the Wind is a novel by American writer Margaret Mitchell , first published in 1936 . + Gone with the Wind (novel) + Gone with the Wind is the only novel by Mitchell published during her lifetime . + Gone with the Wind (film) + The film is regarded as one of the greatest films of all time ; it has placed in the top ten of the American Film Institute 's list of top 100 American films since the list 's inception in 1998 , and in 1989 , the United States Library of Congress selected it for preservation in the National Film Registry . + AFI's 100 Years...100 Movies + The first of the AFI 100 Years ... series of cinematic milestones , AFI 's 100 Years ... 100 Movies is a list of the 100 best American movies , as determined by the American Film Institute from a poll of more than 1,500 artists and leaders in the film industry who chose from a list of 400 nominated movies . + National Film Registry + The National Film Registry ( NFR ) is the United States National Film Preservation Board 's ( NFPB ) selection of films for preservation in the Library of Congress .
explanation_1: Gone with the Wind is a novel, not a book.

hypothesis: Queen Victoria's son failed to belong to a German dynasty.
premise: + House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha + House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha (  German : Haus Sachsen-Coburg und Gotha ) is a German dynasty , the line of the Saxon House of Wettin that ruled the Ernestine duchies including the duchy of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha . + Queen Victoria + Her son and successor , Edward VII , belonged to the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha , the line of his father .
explanation_1: Queen Victoria's son belonged to the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha, the line of his father.

hypothesis: John Lennon was posthumously inducted into a hall of fame.
premise: + John Lennon + He was posthumously inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1987 , and into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame twice , in 1988 as a member of the Beatles and in 1994 as a solo artist . + Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum , located on the shore of Lake Erie in downtown Cleveland , Ohio , recognizes and archives the history of the best-known and most influential artists , producers , engineers , and other notable figures who have had some major influence on the development of rock and roll . + Songwriters Hall of Fame + The Songwriters Hall of Fame ( SHOF ) , was founded in 1969 by songwriter Johnny Mercer and music publisher/songwriter Abe Olman and publisher/executive Howie Richmond to honor those whose work represents and maintains the heritage and legacy of a spectrum of the most beloved songs from the world 's popular music songbook .
explanation_1: John Lennon was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1987, the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1988 and the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1994.
